div.p: Captions to figures:

figure.p: The absolute-magnitude deviations Δ⁢MVΔsubscript𝑀𝑉Delta italic-M POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:end\Delta M_{V} are shown here for both data-sets (B⁢V𝐵𝑉italic-B italic-VBV set in the upper panels, V⁢I𝑉𝐼italic-V italic-IVI set in the lower panels), versus the respective colour indices and log⁡P𝑃OPFUNCTION:logarithm italic-P\log P (in days). Note the large fraction of foreground systems with negative values of Δ⁢MVΔsubscript𝑀𝑉Delta italic-M POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:end\Delta M_{V}. Most systems with blue colors are apparently genuine members and also Blue Stragglers. The approximate locations of the Turn-Off Point for the “metal-rich” GC’s are shown by the thin broken vertical lines (see Figure 5). The Class-1 members are those with Δ⁢MV<0.5Δsubscript𝑀𝑉0.5Delta italic-M POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:less-than NUMBER:0.5\Delta M_{V}<0.5 mag.; the Class-2 members are defined by larger deviations, but smaller than one magnitude.

Histograms of the deviations Δ⁢MVΔsubscript𝑀𝑉Delta italic-M POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:end\Delta M_{V} with the values of MVc⁢a⁢lsuperscriptsubscript𝑀𝑉𝑐𝑎𝑙italic-M POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:end POSTSUPERSCRIPT:start italic-c italic-a italic-l POSTSUPERSCRIPT:endM_{V}^{cal} computed without any metallicity corrections (continuous lines) and with the metallicity corrections of -0.3×[F⁢e/H]0.3delimited-[]𝐹𝑒𝐻ADDOP:minus NUMBER:0.3 MULOP:times OPEN:[ italic-F italic-e MULOP:divide italic-H CLOSE:]-0.3\times[Fe/H] for the B⁢V𝐵𝑉italic-B italic-VBV set and -0.12×[F⁢e/H]0.12delimited-[]𝐹𝑒𝐻ADDOP:minus NUMBER:0.12 MULOP:times OPEN:[ italic-F italic-e MULOP:divide italic-H CLOSE:]-0.12\times[Fe/H] for the V⁢I𝑉𝐼italic-V italic-IVI set added to Equations 1 and 2 (broken lines). See the next figure for the details within a narrow range of the deviations.

The band within -2<Δ⁢MV<+12Δsubscript𝑀𝑉1ADDOP:minus NUMBER:2 RELOP:less-than Delta italic-M POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:less-than ADDOP:plus NUMBER:1-2<\Delta M_{V}<+1 mag. is shown versus the metallicity parameter [F⁢e/H]delimited-[]𝐹𝑒𝐻OPEN:[ italic-F italic-e MULOP:divide italic-H CLOSE:][Fe/H]. The clusters are identified by NGC numbers along the upper edges of the panels. The slanting lines give the corrections ∝-0.3⁢[F⁢e/H]proportional-toabsent0.3delimited-[]𝐹𝑒𝐻RELOP:proportional-to ADDOP:minus NUMBER:0.3 OPEN:[ italic-F italic-e MULOP:divide italic-H CLOSE:]\propto-0.3\,[Fe/H] and ∝-0.12⁢[F⁢e/H]proportional-toabsent0.12delimited-[]𝐹𝑒𝐻RELOP:proportional-to ADDOP:minus NUMBER:0.12 OPEN:[ italic-F italic-e MULOP:divide italic-H CLOSE:]\propto-0.12\,[Fe/H]. The distribution of data points around the zero-deviation line with and without the metallicity corrections is the main argument for abandoning their use in the calibrations. The data for NGC 4372 are shown by open circles with arrows showing the amount of shift for all systems in the cluster under an alternative set of assumptions on (m-M)Vsubscript𝑚𝑀𝑉OPEN:( italic-m ADDOP:minus italic-M CLOSE:) POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:end(m-M)_{V} and EB-Vsubscript𝐸𝐵𝑉italic-E POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-B ADDOP:minus italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:endE_{B-V} (see the text).

Radius changes expected from metallicity variations following the study of Castellani et al. 1999. The parameter C=Δ⁢Y/Δ⁢Z𝐶Δ𝑌Δ𝑍italic-C RELOP:equals Delta italic-Y MULOP:divide Delta italic-ZC=\Delta Y/\Delta Z describing the correlation of the helium abundance change with the heavy-metal abundance change is currently very poorly known.

Color-magnitude diagrams for contact binary systems in globular clusters. Filled circles mark Class-1 member candidates which are most probably the real members of the clusters. Open circles mark Class-2 member candidates which are probably not members. Metallicities of individual systems are coded by the size of the symbol with large symbols for metal-poor systems with [F⁢e/H]<-1.5delimited-[]𝐹𝑒𝐻1.5OPEN:[ italic-F italic-e MULOP:divide italic-H CLOSE:] RELOP:less-than ADDOP:minus NUMBER:1.5[Fe/H]<-1.5. The expected metallicity effects are shown by arrows in the left corners of each panel for [F⁢e/H]=-1delimited-[]𝐹𝑒𝐻1OPEN:[ italic-F italic-e MULOP:divide italic-H CLOSE:] RELOP:equals ADDOP:minus NUMBER:1[Fe/H]=-1 and -22ADDOP:minus NUMBER:2-2. The vertical broken lines give the approximate limits for occurrence of Blue Straggler systems at (B-V)0=0.4subscript𝐵𝑉00.4OPEN:( italic-B ADDOP:minus italic-V CLOSE:) POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:0 POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:equals NUMBER:0.4(B-V)_{0}=0.4 and (V-I)0=0.55subscript𝑉𝐼00.55OPEN:( italic-V ADDOP:minus italic-I CLOSE:) POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:0 POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:equals NUMBER:0.55(V-I)_{0}=0.55. Small crosses show the data for the Disk Population contact systems in open clusters (R98); the (B-V)𝐵𝑉OPEN:( italic-B ADDOP:minus italic-V CLOSE:)(B-V) data have been taken directly from this paper whereas the (V-I)𝑉𝐼OPEN:( italic-V ADDOP:minus italic-I CLOSE:)(V-I) data are from the original papers cited there.

Period-color diagrams for contact binary systems in globular clusters. The symbols used here are identical as in the previous figure. The Short Period Blue Envelopes (SPBE) for the Disk stars are shown as curved lines, as described in the text. The arrows giving the expected variations in the period and color due to metallicity changes for Te⁢f⁢f=5000subscript𝑇𝑒𝑓𝑓5000italic-T POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-e italic-f italic-f POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:equals NUMBER:5000T_{eff}=5000 K have the origin slightly shifted for better visibility from the nominal values of (B-V)0=0.88subscript𝐵𝑉00.88OPEN:( italic-B ADDOP:minus italic-V CLOSE:) POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:0 POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:equals NUMBER:0.88(B-V)_{0}=0.88 and (V-I)0=0.93subscript𝑉𝐼00.93OPEN:( italic-V ADDOP:minus italic-I CLOSE:) POSTSUBSCRIPT:start NUMBER:0 POSTSUBSCRIPT:end RELOP:equals NUMBER:0.93(V-I)_{0}=0.93. To give a feel on how absolute magnitudes relate to the plotted quantities, the slanting dotted lines across the figures give the values of MVc⁢a⁢lsuperscriptsubscript𝑀𝑉𝑐𝑎𝑙italic-M POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:end POSTSUPERSCRIPT:start italic-c italic-a italic-l POSTSUPERSCRIPT:endM_{V}^{cal} (not MVo⁢b⁢ssuperscriptsubscript𝑀𝑉𝑜𝑏𝑠italic-M POSTSUBSCRIPT:start italic-V POSTSUBSCRIPT:end POSTSUPERSCRIPT:start italic-o italic-b italic-s POSTSUPERSCRIPT:endM_{V}^{obs} as in the previous figure as these are individual to systems).

Amplitudes of light variations for both color-index data-sets are shown in relation to de-reddened color indices. The vertical broken lines delineate the regions of Blue Stragglers. The data with crosses superimposed on the circles (closed for Class-1 and open for Class-2 members) mark the EB-type systems. Since their primary eclipses are deeper than for normal contact systems, they have – on the average – larger amplitudes than typical contact system.

The color-index distributions for Class-1 members (continuous line histograms) with added Class-2 members (broken line histograms) are compared with Disk systems from the Baade’s Window OGLE sample (R98) (shaded area). Note that while the OGLE data come from a volume-limited samples (3 kpc, with modifications at the long-period end from the 5 kpc sample), the GC sample most probably contains many detection-selection biases. The OGLE sample data are shown here with arbitrary normalization, only to indicate the shapes of the distributions. The upper panels give the B⁢V𝐵𝑉italic-B italic-VBV set data, the lower panels give the V⁢I𝑉𝐼italic-V italic-IVI set data.
